games.battleship.model

Class Arena

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.battleship.model.Arena

  • public class Arena
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Arena contains the battle area of both players. It has information about both players so a player can fire a missile using this class by providing its identifier and the coordinates of the target location. This class also contains information about the state of the game i.e, whether the game is over or not and which player turn it is.

      Arena is instantiated by providing both the players.

      • fireMissile

        public boolean fireMissile(int enemyX,
                           int enemyY,
                           PlayerId missileFiredBy)
        This method implements the core logic of the game. A player can call this method on enemy's coordinates to fire a missile. This method will update the arena GUI accordingly if the missile hit the ship or water. This method will update the game state in case the game is over. Also, this method will store results in persistent storage and update the winner score board.
        Parameters:
        enemyX - enemy x coordinate
        enemyY - enemy y coordinate
        missileFiredBy - player id of the player who is firing the missile
        Returns:
        true if missile hits the ship of enemy false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case player is trying to fire missile even if its not its turn or player is trying to fire on coordinate it has fired before.
